alert.note: Alert for Concordia (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 14 at 10:37AM CST until December 14 at 1:30PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Concordia Parish in northeastern Louisiana... Adams County in southwestern Mississippi... Northwestern Franklin County in southwestern Mississippi... Southern Jefferson County in southwestern Mississippi... * Until 130 PM CST. * At 1037 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Natchez, Fayette, Kingston, Sibley, Cranfield, Stanton, Stampley, Deer Park, Hamburg, Mcnair and Slocum. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
